1.name: Rage
1.description: Enter a rage as a bonus action. While raging, gain bonus damage to Strength-based melee attacks, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and advantage on Strength checks and saves. Cannot cast spells while raging.

1.name: Unarmored Defense
1.description: While not wearing armor, AC equals 10 + Dex modifier + Con modifier + shield.

2.name: Reckless Attack
2.description: When making your first attack on your turn using Strength, you can attack recklessly, giving advantage on melee weapon attack rolls but giving attackers advantage against you until your next turn.

2.name: Danger Sense
2.description: Gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see, such as traps and spells, as long as you aren't blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

3.name: Primal Path
3.description: Choose a primal path that shapes the nature of your rage.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

5.name: Fast Movement
5.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.

6.name: Path Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Primal Path.

7.name: Feral Instinct
7.description: Gain advantage on initiative rolls. If surprised and not incapacitated, you can act normally on your first turn by entering rage.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Brutal Critical (1 die)
9.description: Roll one additional weapon damage die when determining extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

10.name: Path Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Primal Path.

11.name: Relentless Rage
11.description: If you drop to 0 hit points while raging and don't die, make a DC 10 Constitution save to drop to 1 hit point instead. DC increases by 5 for each use until you finish a long rest.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Brutal Critical (2 dice)
13.description: Roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

14.name: Path Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Primal Path.

15.name: Persistent Rage
15.description: Your rage only ends early if you fall unconscious or choose to end it.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Brutal Critical (3 dice)
17.description: Roll three additional weapon damage dice when determining extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

18.name: Indomitable Might
18.description: If your total for a Strength check is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score in place of the total.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Primal Champion
20.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 24.

3.name: Frenzy
3.description: When you rage, you can go into a frenzy. If you do, for the duration you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

6.name: Mindless Rage
6.description: You can't be charmed or frightened while raging. If charmed or frightened when you enter rage, the effect is suspended for the duration.

10.name: Intimidating Presence
10.description: Use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence. Choose one creature within 30 feet that can see or hear you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature once per long rest.

14.name: Retaliation
14.description: When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

3.name: Totem Spirit
3.description: Choose a totem animal (Bear, Eagle, or Wolf) that grants you a spirit power while raging. Bear: resistance to all damage except psychic. Eagle: other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you. Wolf: friends have advantage on melee attacks against enemies within 5 feet of you.

6.name: Aspect of the Beast
6.description: Gain the aspect of a totem animal. Bear: double carrying capacity and advantage on Strength checks. Eagle: see up to 1 mile away clearly and dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on Perception checks. Wolf: track creatures and move stealthily at normal pace.

10.name: Spirit Walker
10.description: Cast the commune with nature spell as a ritual without expending a spell slot.

14.name: Totemic Attunement
14.description: Gain a totemic attunement. Bear: creatures within 5 feet have disadvantage on attacks against targets other than you. Eagle: fly at half speed while raging. Wolf: knock Large or smaller creatures prone with melee attacks while raging.

3.name: Ancestral Protectors
3.description: When you rage, spectral warriors appear. The first creature you hit with an attack on your turn becomes the target of the warriors, who hinder its attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that target has disadvantage on attack rolls against anyone other than you.

6.name: Spirit Shield
6.description: If you are raging and another creature you can see within 30 feet takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by 2d6. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

10.name: Consult the Spirits
10.description: Cast augury or clairvoyance as rituals without expending spell slots. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

14.name: Vengeful Ancestors
14.description: When you use Spirit Shield, the attacker takes force damage equal to the damage prevented.

3.name: Storm Aura
3.description: When you rage, you emanate a 10-foot aura with a storm effect. Choose Desert (fire damage), Sea (lightning damage), or Tundra (temporary hit points) when you gain this feature.

6.name: Storm Soul
6.description: Gain resistance to your chosen storm type's damage. Desert: you don't suffer effects from extreme heat and can set flammable objects on fire. Sea: breathe underwater and swim speed equal to walking speed. Tundra: don't suffer effects from extreme cold and can freeze water.

10.name: Shielding Storm
10.description: Your storm aura grants you and your allies resistance to the damage type associated with your storm aura.

14.name: Raging Storm
14.description: Your aura's effects become more powerful. Desert: all creatures in aura take fire damage. Sea: you can use a reaction to force a Lightning Strike. Tundra: creatures in aura have their movement reduced.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast bard spells using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You know a number of spells and can cast them using spell slots.

1.name: Bardic Inspiration (d6)
1.description: Use a bonus action to give one creature within 60 feet a Bardic Inspiration die (d6). Once within the next 10 minutes, they can roll it and add the number to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

2.name: Jack of All Trades
2.description: Add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any ability check that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

2.name: Song of Rest (d6)
2.description: During a short rest, you and any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.

3.name: Bard College
3.description: Choose a college that grants you features at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

3.name: Expertise
3.description: Choose two skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check using the chosen proficiencies.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Bardic Inspiration (d8)
5.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d8, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

6.name: Countercharm
6.description: Use your action to grant yourself and allies within 30 feet advantage on saves against being frightened or charmed until the start of your next turn.

6.name: College Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Bard College.

7.name: Font of Inspiration
7.description: You regain all of your expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Song of Rest (d8)
9.description: Your Song of Rest die becomes a d8.

10.name: Magical Secrets
10.description: Choose two spells from any class. These spells count as bard spells for you and don't count against your number of spells known.

10.name: College Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Bard College.

11.name: Improved Bardic Inspiration
11.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d10.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Song of Rest (d10)
13.description: Your Song of Rest die becomes a d10.

14.name: College Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Bard College.

15.name: Magical Secrets
15.description: Choose two more spells from any class. These spells count as bard spells for you.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Song of Rest (d12)
17.description: Your Song of Rest die becomes a d12.

18.name: Superior Inspiration
18.description: When you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Superior Bardic Inspiration
20.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d12, and when you roll initiative and have no uses left, you regain one use.

3.name: Bonus Proficiencies
3.description: Gain proficiency with three skills of your choice.

3.name: Cutting Words
3.description: When a creature within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, use your reaction and expend a Bardic Inspiration die to subtract the number rolled from the creature's roll.

6.name: Additional Magical Secrets
6.description: Learn two spells of your choice from any class. They must be of a level you can cast and count as bard spells for you.

14.name: Peerless Skill
14.description: When you make an ability check, you can expend one use of Bardic Inspiration to add half the number rolled to your check.

3.name: Bonus Proficiencies
3.description: Gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

3.name: Combat Inspiration
3.description: A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can roll that die and add it to a weapon damage roll or to their AC against one attack.

6.name: Extra Attack
6.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

14.name: Battle Magic
14.description: When you use your action to cast a bard spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

3.name: Mantle of Inspiration
3.description: As a bonus action, expend one use of Bardic Inspiration to grant temporary hit points to creatures within 60 feet and allow them to move without provoking opportunity attacks.

6.name: Enthralling Performance
6.description: If you perform for at least 1 minute, choose creatures who heard you to make a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 hour.

14.name: Unbreakable Majesty
14.description: As a bonus action, assume a magically majestic presence. Attackers must make a Charisma saving throw or target someone else instead.

3.name: Psychic Blades
3.description: When you deal damage with a weapon attack, you can expend a use of Bardic Inspiration to deal additional psychic damage.

3.name: Mantle of Whispers
3.description: When a humanoid dies within 30 feet, you can capture their shadow to create a disguise that lasts for 1 hour.

6.name: Shadow Lore
6.description: You can use an action to force a creature to make a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 8 hours, believing you know their darkest secret.

14.name: Shadowy Disguise
14.description: You can vanish and appear as a different person. Creatures must make an Investigation check to see through your disguise.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast cleric spells using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from the cleric spell list.

1.name: Divine Domain
1.description: Choose a domain related to your deity that grants you domain spells and features.

2.name: Channel Divinity (1/rest)
2.description: You can channel divine energy to fuel magical effects. Each domain provides different options.

3.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
3.description: Present your holy symbol and speak a prayer to turn undead creatures that can see or hear you within 30 feet.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Destroy Undead (CR 1/2)
5.description: When an undead of CR 1/2 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

6.name: Domain Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Divine Domain.

7.name: Destroy Undead (CR 1)
7.description: When an undead of CR 1 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Destroy Undead (CR 2)
9.description: When an undead of CR 2 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

10.name: Domain Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Divine Domain.

11.name: Destroy Undead (CR 3)
11.description: When an undead of CR 3 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Destroy Undead (CR 4)
13.description: When an undead of CR 4 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

14.name: Domain Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Divine Domain.

15.name: Destroy Undead (CR 5)
15.description: When an undead of CR 5 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Destroy Undead (CR 6)
17.description: When an undead of CR 6 or lower fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead, it is instantly destroyed.

18.name: Channel Divinity (2/rest)
18.description: You can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests.

18.name: Domain Feature
18.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Divine Domain.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Divine Intervention Improvement
20.description: Your call for divine intervention succeeds automatically, no roll required.

1.name: Bonus Proficiency
1.description: Gain proficiency with heavy armor.

1.name: Disciple of Life
1.description: When you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Preserve Life
2.description: Present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that restores hit points equal to five times your cleric level, divided among creatures within 30 feet.

6.name: Blessed Healer
6.description: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to another creature, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

8.name: Divine Strike (1d8)
8.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause one of your weapon attacks to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

17.name: Supreme Healing
17.description: When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die.

1.name: Bonus Cantrip
1.description: You gain the light cantrip if you don't already know it. This doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

1.name: Warding Flare
1.description: When attacked by a creature within 30 feet that you can see, use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
2.description: Present your holy symbol and dispel magical darkness within 30 feet. Additionally, hostile creatures within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw or take radiant damage.

6.name: Improved Flare
6.description: You can use Warding Flare when a creature you can see within 30 feet attacks a creature other than you.

8.name: Potent Spellcasting
8.description: Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

17.name: Corona of Light
17.description: Use your action to activate an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute. Enemies within 60 feet have disadvantage on saving throws against spells that deal fire or radiant damage.

1.name: Blessing of the Trickster
1.description: Choose another creature within 30 feet to give advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
2.description: Create an illusory duplicate of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses.

6.name: Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows
6.description: Use your Channel Divinity to vanish. You become invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell.

8.name: Divine Strike (1d8)
8.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause one of your weapon attacks to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage.

17.name: Improved Duplicity
17.description: You can create up to four duplicates of yourself, instead of one, when you use Invoke Duplicity. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of them up to 30 feet.

1.name: Bonus Proficiencies
1.description: Gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

1.name: War Priest
1.description: When you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier per long rest.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
2.description: When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.

6.name: Channel Divinity: War God's Blessing
6.description: When a creature within 30 feet makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity.

8.name: Divine Strike (1d8)
8.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause one of your weapon attacks to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type as the weapon's damage.

17.name: Avatar of Battle
17.description: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn
2.description: Present your holy symbol and dispel magical darkness within 30 feet, and hostile creatures in the area take radiant damage.

6.name: Improved Flare
6.description: You can use Warding Flare when a creature you can see within 30 feet attacks a creature other than you.

8.name: Potent Spellcasting
8.description: Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

17.name: Corona of Light
17.description: Use your action to activate an aura of sunlight that lasts for 1 minute. Enemies within 60 feet have disadvantage on saving throws against spells that deal fire or radiant damage.

1.name: Bonus Proficiency
1.description: Gain proficiency with the Stealth skill.

1.name: Blessing of the Trickster
1.description: Use your action to touch a willing creature other than yourself to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks for 1 hour.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity
2.description: Create an illusory duplicate of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space.

6.name: Cloak of Shadows
6.description: When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to grant yourself advantage on any Stealth check and become invisible until the end of your turn or until you attack.

8.name: Divine Strike (1d8)
8.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause one of your weapon attacks to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage.

17.name: Improved Duplicity
17.description: You can create up to four duplicates of yourself when using Invoke Duplicity.

1.name: Bonus Proficiency
1.description: Gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

1.name: War Priest
1.description: When you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier per long rest.

2.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike
2.description: When you make an attack roll, you can use Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

6.name: War God's Blessing
6.description: When a creature within 30 feet makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant a +10 bonus to the roll using your Channel Divinity.

8.name: Divine Strike (1d8)
8.description: Once on each of your turns, you can cause one of your weapon attacks to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon.

17.name: Avatar of Battle
17.description: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

1.name: Druidic
1.description: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak and read it, and can leave hidden messages in natural settings.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast druid spells using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from the druid spell list.

2.name: Wild Shape
2.description: Use your action to assume the shape of a beast you have seen before. You can use this feature twice per short rest.

3.name: Druid Circle
3.description: Choose a circle of druids that grants you features at 2nd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack (Moon Circle)
5.description: If you chose Circle of the Moon, you can attack twice when you take the Attack action while in beast form.

6.name: Circle Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Druid Circle.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

10.name: Circle Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Druid Circle.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

14.name: Circle Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Druid Circle.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

18.name: Timeless Body
18.description: The primal magic you wield slows your aging. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Archdruid
20.description: You can use Wild Shape an unlimited number of times, and you ignore the verbal and somatic components of druid spells, as well as material components that lack a cost.

2.name: Bonus Cantrip
2.description: Learn one additional druid cantrip of your choice.

6.name: Natural Recovery
6.description: During a short rest, recover some of your magical energy. You regain spell slots with a combined level equal to or less than half your druid level.

10.name: Land's Stride
10.description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs no extra movement. You can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed or taking damage.

14.name: Nature's Ward
14.description: You are immune to poison and disease, and you have resistance to the charmed and frightened conditions.

18.name: Nature's Sanctuary
18.description: Creatures of the natural world sense your connection to nature and become hesitant to attack you unless you threaten them first.

2.name: Combat Wild Shape
2.description: You can use Wild Shape as a bonus action, and while transformed you can expend spell slots to regain hit points.

6.name: Circle Forms
6.description: You can transform into beasts with a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, and can transform into beasts with a swimming speed.

10.name: Improved Combat Wild Shape
10.description: You can expend a spell slot to regain uses of Wild Shape, and you can transform into an air elemental, earth elemental, fire elemental, or water elemental.

14.name: Thousand Forms
14.description: You have learned to use magic to alter your physical form. You can cast alter self at will.

2.name: Balm of the Summer Court
2.description: You have a pool of fey energy equal to your druid level + your Wisdom modifier. As a bonus action, you can heal and teleport creatures.

6.name: Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow
6.description: During a short or long rest, you can invoke the shadowy power of the Shadowfell to help guard your respite, creating a 30-foot radius sphere of protection.

10.name: Hidden Paths
10.description: You can use the hidden paths of the Feywild to step from one place to another. As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 60 feet and bring one willing creature with you.

14.name: Walker in Dreams
14.description: The magic of the Feywild grants you the ability to travel mentally or physically through dreamlands and communicate over vast distances during sleep.

2.name: Halo of Spores
2.description: You are surrounded by invisible, necrotic spores. When a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal necrotic damage to it.

6.name: Fungal Infestation
6.description: When a beast or humanoid with CR 1 or lower dies within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to animate it as a zombie for 1 hour.

10.name: Spreading Spores
10.description: You can seed an area with deadly spores. As a bonus action, create a 10-foot cube of spores within 60 feet that lasts for 1 minute.

14.name: Fungal Body
14.description: Your body is infused with fungal magic. You are immune to being blinded, deafened, frightened, or poisoned, and any critical hit against you counts as a normal hit instead.

1.name: Fighting Style
1.description: Choose a fighting style: Archery (+2 to ranged attacks), Defense (+1 AC with armor), Dueling (+2 damage with one-handed weapons), Great Weapon Fighting (reroll 1s and 2s on two-handed weapons), Protection (use shield to impose disadvantage), or Two-Weapon Fighting (add ability modifier to off-hand attacks).

1.name: Second Wind
1.description: Use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. You can use this feature once per short or long rest.

2.name: Action Surge (one use)
2.description: On your turn, you can take one additional action on top of your regular action and a possible bonus action. You can use this feature once per short or long rest.

3.name: Martial Archetype
3.description: Choose a martial archetype that grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack (1)
5.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Ability Score Improvement
6.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

7.name: Martial Archetype Feature
7.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Indomitable (one use)
9.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. You must use the new roll. You can use this feature once per long rest.

10.name: Martial Archetype Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

11.name: Extra Attack (2)
11.description: Attack three times, instead of twice, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Indomitable (two uses)
13.description: You can use Indomitable twice between long rests.

14.name: Martial Archetype Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

15.name: Additional Action Surge
15.description: You can use Action Surge twice per short or long rest, but only once on the same turn.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Indomitable (three uses)
17.description: You can use Indomitable three times between long rests.

18.name: Martial Archetype Feature
18.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Martial Archetype.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Extra Attack (3)
20.description: Attack four times, instead of three, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

3.name: Improved Critical
3.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

7.name: Remarkable Athlete
7.description: Add half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check that doesn't already use your proficiency bonus. Your running long jump distance increases by feet equal to your Strength modifier.

10.name: Additional Fighting Style
10.description: Choose a second option from the Fighting Style class feature.

15.name: Superior Critical
15.description: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

18.name: Survivor
18.description: At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left and aren't incapacitated.

3.name: Combat Superiority
3.description: Learn maneuvers powered by superiority dice (d8s). You start with 4 superiority dice, regained on a short or long rest.

3.name: Student of War
3.description: Gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

7.name: Know Your Enemy
7.description: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own.

10.name: Improved Combat Superiority
10.description: Your superiority dice become d10s, and you gain two additional superiority dice.

15.name: Relentless
15.description: When you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.

18.name: Improved Maneuvers
18.description: Your superiority dice become d12s, and you gain two additional superiority dice.

3.name: Spellcasting
3.description: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells. You learn spells from the wizard spell list, with a focus on abjuration and evocation.

3.name: Weapon Bond
3.description: You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon. You can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you are incapacitated, and you can summon it as a bonus action.

7.name: War Magic
7.description: When you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

10.name: Eldritch Strike
10.description: When you hit a creature with your weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

15.name: Arcane Charge
15.description: When you use your Action Surge, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see before or after the additional action.

18.name: Improved War Magic
18.description: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

3.name: Arcane Archer Lore
3.description: Learn magical theory or some of the secrets of nature. Choose to gain proficiency in either the Arcana or the Nature skill, and you learn either the prestidigitation or the druidcraft cantrip.

3.name: Arcane Shot
3.description: Learn to unleash special magical effects with some of your shots. You learn two Arcane Shot options and gain more at higher levels.

7.name: Magic Arrow
7.description: Whenever you fire a nonmagical arrow from a shortbow or longbow, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

10.name: Curving Shot
10.description: When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to redirect the arrow toward a new target within 60 feet of the original target.

15.name: Ever-Ready Shot
15.description: Your magical archery is available whenever battle starts. If you roll initiative and have no uses of Arcane Shot remaining, you regain one use of it.

18.name: Arrowstorm
18.description: You can use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within a 10-foot-radius sphere within range. You must have ammunition for each target.

1.name: Unarmored Defense
1.description: While wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

1.name: Martial Arts
1.description: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls of unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You can roll a d4 for damage instead of normal damage. When you attack with unarmed strike or monk weapon, you can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action.

2.name: Ki
2.description: Your training allows you to harness mystic energy of ki. You have ki points equal to your monk level, regained on a short or long rest. You can spend ki to make additional attacks, dodge, dash, or disengage.

2.name: Unarmored Movement
2.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

3.name: Monastic Tradition
3.description: Choose a monastic tradition that grants you features at 3rd, 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

5.name: Slow Fall
5.description: You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

6.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
6.description: Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

6.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Monastic Tradition.

7.name: Evasion
7.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

7.name: Stillness of Mind
7.description: You can use your action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be charmed or frightened.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Unarmored Movement Improvement
9.description: You gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

10.name: Purity of Body
10.description: You are immune to disease and poison.

10.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Monastic Tradition.

11.name: Insightful Strike
11.description: You can spend 1 ki point to give yourself advantage on your next attack roll, or spend 3 ki points to make all attacks this turn have advantage.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
13.description: You learn to touch the ki of other minds so that you understand all spoken languages and any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

14.name: Diamond Soul
14.description: You gain proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

14.name: Monastic Tradition Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Monastic Tradition.

15.name: Timeless Body
15.description: You no longer age and can't be aged magically.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Empty Body
17.description: You can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During this time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.

18.name: Perfect Self
18.description: When you roll for initiative and have no ki points remaining, you regain 4 ki points.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Flurry of Blows Improvement
20.description: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can make up to three additional attacks instead of two.

3.name: Open Hand Technique
3.description: When you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of several effects: knock prone, push 15 feet away, or prevent reactions until end of your next turn.

6.name: Wholeness of Body
6.description: You gain the ability to heal yourself. As an action, you can regain hit points equal to three times your monk level. You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

11.name: Tranquility
11.description: At the end of a long rest, you gain the effect of a sanctuary spell that lasts until the start of your next long rest (the spell can end early as normal).

17.name: Quivering Palm
17.description: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to start imperceptible vibrations. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be reduced to 0 hit points.

3.name: Shadow Arts
3.description: You can use ki to duplicate the effects of certain spells: minor illusion, pass without trace, darkness, darkvision, and silence.

6.name: Shadow Step
6.description: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

11.name: Cloak of Shadows
11.description: You have learned to become one with the shadows. When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become invisible until you make an attack, cast a spell, or are in an area of bright light.

17.name: Opportunist
17.description: You can exploit a creature's momentary distraction when it is hit by an attack. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack made by a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against that creature.

3.name: Disciple of the Elements
3.description: You learn magical disciplines that harness the power of the four elements. You learn one discipline and gain more at higher levels.

6.name: Elemental Disciplines
6.description: You learn additional elemental disciplines. You can spend ki points to cast spells or create elemental effects.

11.name: Improved Disciplines
11.description: You learn more powerful elemental disciplines and can spend more ki points to create greater effects.

17.name: Mastery
17.description: You have mastered the elements. You learn the most powerful elemental disciplines and can create devastating elemental effects.

3.name: Implements of Mercy
3.description: You gain proficiency in the Insight and Medicine skills, and proficiency with the herbalism kit. You also gain a special mask that helps channel your ki.

6.name: Hand of Healing
6.description: As an action, you can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

6.name: Hand of Harm
6.description: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to deal extra necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

11.name: Protective Spirit
11.description: Your protective techniques can shield you from harm. When you start your turn and are below half your maximum hit points, you can regain hit points equal to 1d4 + your Wisdom modifier.

17.name: Hand of Ultimate Mercy
17.description: Your mastery of life energy grants you the power to overcome death. As an action, you can touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 5 ki points to restore it to life with 4d10 + your Wisdom modifier hit points.

1.name: Divine Sense
1.description: You can detect good and evil. As an action, you can detect celestials, fiends, and undead within 60 feet, as well as consecrated or desecrated objects. You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier per long rest.

1.name: Lay on Hands
1.description: You have a pool of healing power equal to your paladin level  5. As an action, you can heal a creature or cure one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: Choose a fighting style: Defense (+1 AC with armor), Dueling (+2 damage with one-handed weapons), Great Weapon Fighting (reroll 1s and 2s), or Protection (use shield to impose disadvantage).

2.name: Spellcasting
2.description: You can cast paladin spells using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from the paladin spell list.

2.name: Divine Smite
2.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.

3.name: Divine Health
3.description: You are immune to disease.

3.name: Sacred Oath
3.description: Choose a sacred oath that grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 15th, and 20th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Aura of Protection
6.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

7.name: Sacred Oath Feature
7.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sacred Oath.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Aura of Courage
9.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be frightened while you are conscious.

10.name: Sacred Oath Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sacred Oath.

11.name: Improved Divine Smite
11.description: You are so suffused with righteous might that all your melee weapon strikes carry divine power with them. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Cleansing Touch
13.description: You can use your action to end one spell on yourself or on one willing creature that you touch. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier per long rest.

14.name: Aura Improvements
14.description: Your aura features now affect friendly creatures within 30 feet of you, rather than 10 feet.

15.name: Sacred Oath Feature
15.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sacred Oath.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Aura Improvements
17.description: Your aura features continue to improve in range and power.

18.name: Aura Improvements
18.description: Your aura features reach their maximum potential.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Sacred Oath Feature
20.description: Gain the capstone feature from your chosen Sacred Oath.

3.name: Sacred Weapon
3.description: As an action, you can imbue one weapon with positive energy for 1 minute. It becomes magical, sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius, and you can use your Charisma modifier for attack rolls with it.

3.name: Turn the Unholy
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to turn fiends and undead.

7.name: Aura of Devotion
7.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be charmed while you are conscious.

15.name: Purity of Spirit
15.description: You are always under the effects of a protection from evil and good spell.

20.name: Holy Nimbus
20.description: As an action, you can emanate an aura of sunlight for 1 minute. Bright light radiates from you in a 30-foot radius, enemies in the light take radiant damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by fiends or undead.

3.name: Nature's Wrath
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to ensnare foes. As an action, you can cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 10 feet of you.

3.name: Turn the Faithless
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to turn fey and fiends.

7.name: Aura of Warding
7.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to damage from spells.

15.name: Undying Sentinel
15.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points and are not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. Additionally, you suffer none of the drawbacks of old age.

20.name: Elder Champion
20.description: You can assume the form of an ancient force of nature for 1 minute. During this time, enemies within 10 feet of you take radiant damage at the start of their turn, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

3.name: Abjure Enemy
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike terror into a foe. As an action, choose one creature within 60 feet that you can see. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute.

3.name: Vow of Enmity
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to gain advantage on attack rolls against one creature for 1 minute.

7.name: Relentless Avenger
7.description: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, you can move up to half your speed immediately after the attack as part of the same reaction.

15.name: Soul of Vengeance
15.description: When a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity makes an attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature if it is within range.

20.name: Avenging Angel
20.description: You can assume the form of an angelic avenger for 1 hour. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet, and enemies within 30 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you.

3.name: Peerless Athlete
3.description: You can use your Channel Divinity to augment your athleticism. When you make an Athletics or Acrobatics check, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

3.name: Divine Smite Improvement
3.description: Your Divine Smite deals additional damage when used against fiends and undead.

7.name: Inspiring Smite
7.description: When you deal damage to a creature with your Divine Smite, you can distribute temporary hit points to creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you, which can include yourself.

15.name: Aura of Alacrity
15.description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your proficiency bonus.

20.name: Glorious Defense
20.description: You can turn defense into a sudden strike. When you or another creature you can see within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant a bonus to the target's AC and then make one weapon attack if the attack misses.

1.name: Favored Enemy
1.description: Choose a type of creature you have specialized knowledge of. You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

1.name: Natural Explorer
1.description: Choose a favored terrain type. When you make a Wisdom (Survival) check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you're proficient with.

2.name: Fighting Style
2.description: Choose a fighting style: Archery, Defense, Dueling, or Two-Weapon Fighting.

2.name: Spellcasting
2.description: You can cast ranger spells using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. You know a number of spells from the ranger spell list.

3.name: Primeval Awareness
3.description: You can use your action and expend one ranger spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you, for 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend.

3.name: Ranger Archetype
3.description: Choose an archetype that grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Favored Enemy Improvement
6.description: Choose an additional favored enemy, and also increase the damage you deal to all your favored enemies.

7.name: Ranger Archetype Feature
7.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Ranger Archetype.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Land's Stride
9.description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them.

10.name: Hide in Plain Sight
10.description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You must have access to fresh mud, dirt, plants, soot, and other naturally occurring materials with which to create your camouflage.

11.name: Ranger Archetype Feature
11.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Ranger Archetype.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Primeval Awareness Improvement
13.description: Your Primeval Awareness extends to additional creature types.

14.name: Vanish
14.description: You can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.

15.name: Ranger Archetype Feature
15.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Ranger Archetype.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Feral Senses
17.description: You gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it.

18.name: Foe Slayer
18.description: You become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your favored enemies.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Ranger Archetype Feature
20.description: Gain the capstone feature from your chosen Ranger Archetype.

3.name: Hunter's Prey
3.description: Choose Colossus Slayer (extra damage to wounded enemies), Giant Killer (reaction attack against Large+ creatures), or Horde Breaker (attack an additional creature).

7.name: Defensive Tactics
7.description: Choose Escape the Horde (opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage), Multiattack Defense (bonus AC after being hit), or Steel Will (advantage on saves against being frightened).

11.name: Multiattack
11.description: Choose Volley (attack all creatures in a 10-foot radius) or Whirlwind Attack (melee attack against any number of creatures within reach).

15.name: Superior Hunter's Defense
15.description: Choose Evasion (take no damage on successful Dex saves), Stand Against the Tide (redirect missed attacks to other creatures), or Uncanny Dodge (halve damage from one attack per turn).

3.name: Ranger's Companion
3.description: You gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you.

7.name: Exceptional Training
7.description: On any of your turns when your beast companion doesn't attack, you can use a bonus action to command the beast to take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action on its turn.

11.name: Bestial Fury
11.description: Your beast companion can make two attacks when you command it to use the Attack action.

15.name: Share Spells
15.description: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

3.name: Dread Ambusher
3.description: You can give yourself a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier. At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and if you take the Attack action, you can make one additional weapon attack.

3.name: Umbral Sight
3.description: You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet. You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on darkvision.

7.name: Iron Mind
7.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws.

11.name: Stalker's Fury
11.description: Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

15.name: Shadowy Dodge
15.description: When a creature makes an attack roll against you and doesn't have advantage on the roll, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on it.

3.name: Detect Portal
3.description: You gain the ability to magically sense the presence of a planar portal. As an action, you detect the distance and direction to the closest planar portal within 1 mile of you.

3.name: Planar Warrior
3.description: You can designate one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The next time you hit that creature on this turn with a weapon attack, all damage dealt by the attack becomes force damage.

7.name: Ethereal Step
7.description: You can cast the misty step spell without expending a spell slot. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

11.name: Distant Strike
11.description: When you take the Attack action, you can teleport up to 10 feet before each attack to an unoccupied space you can see. If you attack at least two different creatures with the action, you can make one additional attack against a third creature.

15.name: Spectral Defense
15.description: When you take damage from an attack, you can use your reaction to give yourself resistance to all of that attack's damage on this turn.

1.name: Expertise
1.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

1.name: Sneak Attack
1.description: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

1.name: Thieves' Cant
1.description: You have learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.

2.name: Cunning Action
2.description: You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

3.name: Roguish Archetype
3.description: Choose an archetype that grants you features at 3rd, 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Uncanny Dodge
5.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

6.name: Expertise Improvement
6.description: Choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves' tools) to gain the benefit of Expertise.

7.name: Evasion
7.description: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Archetype Feature
9.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Roguish Archetype.

10.name: Ability Score Improvement
10.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

11.name: Reliable Talent
11.description: You have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Archetype Feature
13.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Roguish Archetype.

14.name: Blindsense
14.description: If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

15.name: Slippery Mind
15.description: You have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Archetype Feature
17.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Roguish Archetype.

18.name: Elusive
18.description: You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Stroke of Luck
20.description: You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. If your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20.

3.name: Fast Hands
3.description: You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock, or take the Use an Object action.

3.name: Second-Story Work
3.description: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement. In addition, when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.

9.name: Supreme Sneak
9.description: You have advantage on a Dexterity (Stealth) check if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

13.name: Use Magic Device
13.description: You have learned enough about the workings of magic that you can improvise the use of items even when they are not intended for you. You ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

17.name: Thief's Reflexes
17.description: You have become adept at laying ambushes and quickly escaping danger. You can take two turns during the first round of any combat. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at your initiative minus 10.

3.name: Bonus Proficiencies
3.description: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit and the poisoner's kit.

3.name: Assassinate
3.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet. In addition, any hit you score against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.

9.name: Infiltration Expertise
9.description: You can unfailingly create false identities for yourself. You must spend seven days and 25 gp to establish the history, profession, and affiliations for an identity.

13.name: Impostor
13.description: You gain the ability to unerringly mimic another person's speech, writing, and behavior. You must spend at least three hours studying these three components of the person's behavior.

17.name: Death Strike
17.description: You become a master of instant death. When you attack and hit a creature that is surprised, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack against the creature.

3.name: Spellcasting
3.description: You gain the ability to cast spells. You learn spells from the wizard spell list, focusing on enchantment and illusion spells.

3.name: Mage Hand Legerdemain
3.description: When you cast mage hand, you can make the spectral hand invisible, and you can perform additional tasks with it including stowing or retrieving objects, using thieves' tools, and performing sleight of hand.

9.name: Magical Ambush
9.description: If you are hidden from a creature when you cast a spell on it, the creature has disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell this turn.

13.name: Versatile Trickster
13.description: You gain the ability to distract targets with your mage hand. As a bonus action on your turn, you can designate a creature within 5 feet of the spectral hand. Doing so gives you advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of the turn.

17.name: Spell Thief
17.description: You gain the ability to magically steal the knowledge of how to cast a spell from another spellcaster. When a creature casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a saving throw. On a failed save, you negate the spell's effect against you, and you steal the knowledge of the spell.

3.name: Fancy Footwork
3.description: During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

3.name: Rakish Audacity
3.description: You can add your Charisma modifier to your initiative rolls. You also gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; you don't need advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are within 5 feet of it, no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

9.name: Panache
9.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to make a Charisma (Persuasion) check contested by a creature's Wisdom (Insight) check. On a success, the creature is charmed by you or frightened of you (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

13.name: Elegant Maneuver
13.description: You can use a bonus action to gain advantage on the next Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) check you make during the same turn.

17.name: Master Duelist
17.description: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you.

1.name: Otherworldly Patron
1.description: You have struck a pact with an otherworldly being of your choice that grants you features at 1st, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

1.name: Pact Magic
1.description: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

2.name: Eldritch Invocations
2.description: You learn two eldritch invocations of your choice. You learn additional invocations at higher levels and can replace them when you gain a level.

3.name: Pact Boon
3.description: Your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you. Choose Pact of the Tome (ritual book with extra spells), Pact of the Chain (find familiar with special options), or Pact of the Blade (create a pact weapon).

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Additional Invocation
5.description: You learn one additional eldritch invocation of your choice.

6.name: Otherworldly Patron Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Otherworldly Patron.

7.name: Additional Invocation
7.description: You learn one additional eldritch invocation of your choice.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Additional Invocation
9.description: You learn one additional eldritch invocation of your choice.

10.name: Otherworldly Patron Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Otherworldly Patron.

11.name: Mystic Arcanum (6th level)
11.description: Your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list as this arcanum. You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Mystic Arcanum (7th level)
13.description: You learn a 7th-level spell of your choice from the warlock spell list. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot.

14.name: Otherworldly Patron Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Otherworldly Patron.

15.name: Mystic Arcanum (8th level)
15.description: You learn an 8th-level spell of your choice from the warlock spell list. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Mystic Arcanum (9th level)
17.description: You learn a 9th-level spell of your choice from the warlock spell list. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot.

18.name: Additional Invocation
18.description: You learn one additional eldritch invocation of your choice.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Eldritch Master
20.description: You can draw on your inner reserve of mystical power while entreating your patron to regain expended spell slots. You can spend 1 minute entreating your patron for aid to regain all your expended spell slots from your Pact Magic feature. Once you regain spell slots with this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

1.name: Dark One's Blessing
1.description: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level (minimum of 1).

6.name: Dark One's Own Luck
6.description: You can call on your patron to alter fate in your favor. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a d10 to your roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

10.name: Fiendish Resilience
10.description: You can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature.

14.name: Hurl Through Hell
14.description: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape, taking 10d10 psychic damage and returning to the space it previously occupied at the end of your next turn.

1.name: Fey Presence
1.description: As an action, you can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. Creatures that fail are charmed by you until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

6.name: Misty Escape
6.description: You can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell.

10.name: Beguiling Defenses
10.description: You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature.

14.name: Dark Delirium
14.description: You can plunge a creature into an illusory realm. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute.

1.name: Telepathic Communication
1.description: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature, but it must be able to understand at least one language.

6.name: Entropic Ward
6.description: You learn to magically ward yourself against attack and to turn an enemy's failed strike into good luck for yourself. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll.

10.name: Thought Shield
10.description: Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you do.

14.name: Create Thrall
14.description: You gain the ability to infect a humanoid's mind with the alien magic of your patron. You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid. That creature is then charmed by you until a remove curse spell is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or you use this feature again.

1.name: Healing Light
1.description: You gain the ability to channel celestial energy to heal wounds. You have a pool of d6s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + your warlock level. As a bonus action, you can heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you, spending dice from the pool.

6.name: Radiant Soul
6.description: Your link to the Celestial allows you to serve as a conduit for radiant energy. You have resistance to radiant damage, and when you cast a spell that deals radiant or fire damage, you can add your Charisma modifier to one radiant or fire damage roll of that spell.

10.name: Celestial Resilience
10.description: You gain temporary hit points whenever you finish a short or long rest. These temporary hit points equal your warlock level + your Charisma modifier. Additionally, choose up to five creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain temporary hit points equal to half your warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

14.name: Searing Vengeance
14.description: The radiant energy you channel allows you to resist death. When you have to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast wizard spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from your spellbook, and you can cast spells as rituals if they have the ritual tag.

1.name: Arcane Recovery
1.description: You can regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up).

2.name: Arcane Tradition
2.description: Choose an arcane tradition that grants you features at 2nd, 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

3.name: Cantrip Formulas
3.description: You have scribed a set of arcane formulas in your spellbook that you can use to formulate a cantrip in your mind. Whenever you finish a long rest and consult your spellbook, you can replace one wizard cantrip you know with another cantrip from the wizard spell list.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Third Level Spells
5.description: You gain access to 3rd-level wizard spells.

6.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Arcane Tradition.

7.name: Fourth Level Spells
7.description: You gain access to 4th-level wizard spells.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Fifth Level Spells
9.description: You gain access to 5th-level wizard spells.

10.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
10.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Arcane Tradition.

11.name: Sixth Level Spells
11.description: You gain access to 6th-level wizard spells.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Seventh Level Spells
13.description: You gain access to 7th-level wizard spells.

14.name: Arcane Tradition Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Arcane Tradition.

15.name: Eighth Level Spells
15.description: You gain access to 8th-level wizard spells.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Ninth Level Spells
17.description: You gain access to 9th-level wizard spells.

18.name: Spell Mastery
18.description: You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell that are in your spellbook. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Signature Spells
20.description: You gain mastery over two powerful spells and can cast them with little effort. Choose two 3rd-level wizard spells in your spellbook as your signature spells. You can cast each of these spells once at 3rd level without expending a spell slot.

2.name: Evocation Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an evocation spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Sculpt Spells
2.description: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocation spells. When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

6.name: Potent Cantrip
6.description: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

10.name: Empowered Evocation
10.description: You can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

14.name: Overchannel
14.description: You can increase the power of your simpler spells. When you cast a wizard spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before you finish a long rest, you take 2d12 necrotic damage for each level of the spell, immediately after you cast it.

2.name: Abjuration Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Arcane Ward
2.description: You can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier.

6.name: Projected Ward
6.description: When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, the warded creature takes any remaining damage.

10.name: Improved Abjuration
10.description: When you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell (as in counterspell and dispel magic), you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

14.name: Spell Resistance
14.description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells. Furthermore, you have resistance against the damage of spells.

2.name: Divination Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Portent
2.description: You can peer through time to see future events. When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.

6.name: Expert Divination
6.description: Casting divination spells comes so easily to you that it expends only a fraction of your spellcasting efforts.
