When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher using a spell slot, you regain one expended spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level lower than the spell you cast and can't be higher than 5th level.

10.name: The Third Eye
10.description: You can use your action to increase your powers of perception. When you do so, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you are incapacitated or you take a short or long rest: Darkvision, Ethereal Sight, Greater Comprehension, or See Invisibility.

14.name: Greater Portent
14.description: The visions in your dreams intensify and paint a more accurate picture of what is to come. You roll three d20s for your Portent feature, rather than two.

2.name: Enchantment Savant
2.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an enchantment spell into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Hypnotic Gaze
2.description: Your soft words and enchanting gaze can magically enthrall another creature. As an action, choose one creature that you can see within 5 feet of you. If the target can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

6.name: Split Enchantment
6.description: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature within range.

10.name: Alter Memories
10.description: You gain the ability to make a creature unaware of your magical influence on it. When you cast an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, you can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being charmed.

14.name: Master Enchanter
14.description: Your ability to entrance creatures becomes more potent. You can cast suggestion at will, without expending a spell slot.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast sorcerer spells using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You know a number of spells from the sorcerer spell list and can cast them without preparing them in advance.

1.name: Sorcerous Origin
1.description: Choose a sorcerous origin that grants you features at 1st, 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

2.name: Font of Magic
2.description: You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.

2.name: Flexible Casting
2.description: You can use your sorcery points to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points as a bonus action.

3.name: Metamagic
3.description: You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two Metamagic options and learn additional options at higher levels.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Magical Guidance
5.description: You can tap into your inner wellspring of magic to try to conjure success from failure. When you make an ability check that fails, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll, potentially changing the outcome.

6.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sorcerous Origin.

7.name: Additional Metamagic
7.description: You learn one additional Metamagic option of your choice.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Fifth Level Spells
9.description: You gain access to 5th-level sorcerer spells.

10.name: Additional Metamagic
10.description: You learn one additional Metamagic option of your choice.

11.name: Sixth Level Spells
11.description: You gain access to 6th-level sorcerer spells.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Seventh Level Spells
13.description: You gain access to 7th-level sorcerer spells.

14.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
14.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sorcerous Origin.

15.name: Eighth Level Spells
15.description: You gain access to 8th-level sorcerer spells.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Ninth Level Spells
17.description: You gain access to 9th-level sorcerer spells.

17.name: Additional Metamagic
17.description: You learn one additional Metamagic option of your choice.

18.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
18.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sorcerous Origin.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Sorcerous Restoration
20.description: You regain 4 expended sorcery points whenever you finish a short rest.

1.name: Dragon Ancestor
1.description: Choose one type of dragon as your ancestor. The damage type associated with each dragon is used by features you gain later.

1.name: Draconic Resilience
1.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class. Additionally, parts of your skin are covered by a thin sheen of dragon-like scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

6.name: Elemental Affinity
6.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry, you can add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of that spell. At the same time, you can spend 1 sorcery point to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.

14.name: Dragon Wings
14.description: You gain the ability to sprout a pair of dragon wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current speed. You can create these wings as a bonus action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn.

18.name: Draconic Presence
18.description: You can channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor. As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to draw on this power and exude an aura of awe or fear (your choice) to a distance of 60 feet. For 1 minute, each hostile creature that starts its turn in this aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed (if you chose awe) or frightened (if you chose fear) until the aura ends.

1.name: Wild Magic Surge
1.description: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, the DM can have you roll a d20. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect.

1.name: Tides of Chaos
1.description: You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

6.name: Bend Luck
6.description: You have the ability to twist fate using your wild magic. When another creature you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction and spend 2 sorcery points to roll 1d4 and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty (your choice) to the creature's roll.

14.name: Controlled Chaos
14.description: You gain a modicum of control over the surges of your wild magic. Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can roll twice and use either number.

18.name: Spell Bombardment
18.description: The harmful energy of your spells intensifies. When you roll damage for a spell and roll the highest number possible on any of the dice, choose one of those dice, roll it again and add that roll to the damage. You can use the feature only once per turn.

1.name: Divine Magic
1.description: Your link to the divine allows you to learn spells from the cleric class. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the cleric spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell.

1.name: Favored by the Gods
1.description: Divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll 2d4 and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

6.name: Empowered Healing
6.description: The divine energy coursing through you can empower healing spells. Whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to restore hit points with a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once.

14.name: Otherworldly Wings
14.description: You can use a bonus action to manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The wings last until you're incapacitated, you die, or you dismiss them as a bonus action.

18.name: Unearthly Recovery
18.description: You gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a bonus action when you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

1.name: Wind Speaker
1.description: The arcane magic you command is infused with elemental air. You can speak, read, and write Primordial (including its dialects Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran).

1.name: Tempestuous Magic
1.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to cause whirling gusts of elemental air to briefly surround you, immediately before or after you cast a spell of 1st level or higher. Doing so allows you to fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

6.name: Heart of the Storm
6.description: You gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to deal lightning or thunder damage equal to your Charisma modifier to each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you.

14.name: Storm Guide
14.description: You can manipulate the weather around you. As an action, you can change the weather in a 1-mile radius centered on you. You can create a stormy or calm condition, and it lasts for 1 hour.

18.name: Wind Soul
18.description: You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage. Additionally, you can cast the spell control weather without expending a spell slot or using material components. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

1.name: Magical Tinkering
1.description: You have learned how to imbue tiny objects with minor magical properties. At the end of a long rest, you can touch a tiny nonmagical object as an action and give it one of the following magical properties of your choice: shed bright light, record and playback a message, emit an odor or sound. You can have a number of objects affected equal to your Intelligence modifier.

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You can cast artificer spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. You prepare spells from the artificer spell list, and you can cast spells as rituals if they have the ritual tag.

2.name: Infuse Item
2.description: You gain the ability to imbue mundane items with certain magical infusions. You learn two infusions and can infuse two items. You learn additional infusions and can infuse more items as you gain levels.

2.name: The Right Tool for the Job
2.description: You produce the perfect tool for any occasion. During a long rest, you can touch a set of artisan's tools. Until the end of your next long rest or until you die, you gain proficiency with those tools.

3.name: Artificer Specialist
3.description: Choose an Artificer Specialist that grants you features at 3rd, 5th, 9th, and 15th level. Your choice grants you specialist spells, which don't count against your number of spells known.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

5.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
5.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Artificer Specialist.

6.name: Tool Expertise
6.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

6.name: Infusion Improvement
6.description: You learn two new infusions and can infuse one additional item.

7.name: Flash of Genius
7.description: You gain the ability to come up with solutions under pressure. When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to the roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

9.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
9.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Artificer Specialist.

10.name: Magic Item Adept
10.description: You have a deeper understanding of magic items. You can attune to up to four magic items at once. In addition, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws per magic item you are currently attuned to.

10.name: Infusion Improvement
10.description: You learn two new infusions and can infuse one additional item.

11.name: Spell-Storing Item
11.description: You can now store a spell in an object. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one simple or martial weapon or one item that you can use as a spellcasting focus, and you store a spell in it, choosing a 1st- or 2nd-level spell from the artificer spell list that requires 1 action to cast. While holding the object, a creature can take an action to produce the spell's effect from it, using your spellcasting ability modifier.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

13.name: Fourth Level Spells
13.description: You gain access to 4th-level artificer spells.

14.name: Magic Item Savant
14.description: Your understanding of magic items is unmatched. You can attune to up to five magic items at once. In addition, you ignore all class, race, spell, and level requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

14.name: Infusion Improvement
14.description: You learn two new infusions and can infuse one additional item.

15.name: Artificer Specialist Feature
15.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Artificer Specialist.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

17.name: Fifth Level Spells
17.description: You gain access to 5th-level artificer spells.

18.name: Magic Item Master
18.description: You can attune to up to six magic items at once.

18.name: Infusion Improvement
18.description: You learn two new infusions and can infuse one additional item.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each, or take a feat.

20.name: Soul of Artifice
20.description: You have developed a mystical connection to your magic items. You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws per magic item you are currently attuned to. In addition, if you're reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to end one of your artificer infusions, causing you to drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Alchemist Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 1st level - cure wounds, identify; 2nd level - aid, web; 3rd level - create food and water, mass healing word; 4th level - blight, death ward; 5th level - greater restoration, raise dead.

3.name: Experimental Elixir
3.description: Whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce an experimental elixir in an empty flask you touch. Roll on the Experimental Elixir table for the elixir's effect, which is triggered when someone drinks the elixir. You can create additional elixirs by expending a spell slot of 1st level or higher for each one.

5.name: Alchemical Savant
5.description: You develop masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them. Whenever you cast a spell using your alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one damage or healing roll of the spell equal to your Intelligence modifier.

9.name: Restorative Reagents
9.description: You can incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works. Whenever a creature drinks an experimental elixir you created, the creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, you can cast lesser restoration without expending a spell slot, provided you use alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus.

15.name: Chemical Mastery
15.description: You have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments. You gain resistance to acid damage and poison damage, and you are immune to the poisoned condition. In addition, you can cast greater restoration and heal without expending a spell slot, provided you use alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus.

3.name: Tools of the Trade
3.description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor, smith's tools, and thieves' tools. If you already have proficiency with smith's tools, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Armorer Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 1st level - magic missile, thunderwave; 2nd level - mirror image, shatter; 3rd level - hypnotic pattern, lightning bolt; 4th level - fire shield, greater invisibility; 5th level - passwall, wall of force.

3.name: Arcane Armor
3.description: Your metallurgical pursuits have led to you making armor a conduit for your artificer magic. As an action, you can turn a suit of heavy armor you are wearing into power armor, provided you have smith's tools in hand. You can doff or don the armor as an action. The armor replaces any missing limbs, functioning identically to a body part it is replacing.

3.name: Armor Model
3.description: You can customize your power armor. When you do so, choose one of the following armor models: Guardian or Infiltrator. The model you choose gives you special benefits while you wear it.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

9.name: Armor Modifications
9.description: You learn how to use your artificer infusions to specially modify your power armor. Any of the armor's special weapon attacks are magical. When you make an attack with this weapon and miss, you can use your bonus action to repeat the attack against the same target.

15.name: Perfected Armor
15.description: Your power armor gains additional benefits based on its model. Guardian model gains temporary hit points and Thunder Gauntlets deal extra damage. Infiltrator model gains advantage on Stealth checks and Lightning Launcher attacks have increased range and damage.

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with woodcarver's tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Artillerist Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 1st level - identify, shield; 2nd level - scorching ray, shatter; 3rd level - fireball, wind wall; 4th level - ice storm, wall of fire; 5th level - cone of cold, wall of force.

3.name: Eldritch Cannons
3.description: You learn how to create magical cannons. Using woodcarver's tools or smith's tools, you can take an action to magically create a Small eldritch cannon in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you. A Small eldritch cannon occupies its space, and you can activate it as a bonus action on each of your turns.

5.name: Arcane Firearm
5.description: You know how to turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm, a conduit for your destructive spells. When you finish a long rest, you can use woodcarver's tools to carve special sigils into a wand, staff, or rod and thereby turn it into your arcane firearm. When you cast an artificer spell through the firearm, roll a d8, and you gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage rolls equal to the number rolled.

9.name: Explosive Cannon
9.description: Every eldritch cannon you create is more destructive. Your cannons deal an extra 1d8 damage on a hit. Moreover, you can now have two cannons at the same time. You can create two with the same action, and you can activate both of them with the same bonus action.

15.name: Fortified Position
15.description: You're a master at forming well-defended emplacements using Eldritch Cannon. You and your allies have half cover while within 10 feet of a cannon you create with Eldritch Cannons, as a result of a shimmering field of magical force that the cannon emits. You can now have three cannons at the same time.

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with leatherworker's tools, smith's tools, and thieves' tools. If you already have proficiency with any of these tools, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Battle Smith Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared: 1st level - heroism, shield; 2nd level - branding smite, warding bond; 3rd level - aura of vitality, conjure barrage; 4th level - aura of purity, fire shield; 5th level - banishing smite, mass cure wounds.

3.name: Battle Ready
3.description: Your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways: You gain proficiency with martial weapons. When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

3.name: Steel Defender
3.description: Your tinkering has borne you a faithful companion, a steel defender. It's friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. In combat, the steel defender shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

9.name: Arcane Jolt
9.description: You learn new ways to channel arcane energy to harm or heal. When either you hit a target with a magic weapon attack or your steel defender hits a target, you can channel magical energy through the strike to create one of the following effects: The target takes an extra 2d6 force damage, or choose one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of the target. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring 2d6 hit points to it.

15.name: Improved Defender
15.description: Your Arcane Jolt and steel defender become more powerful. The extra damage and the healing of your Arcane Jolt both increase to 4d6. Your steel defender gains a +2 bonus to Armor Class. Whenever your steel defender uses its Deflect Attack, the attacker takes force damage equal to 1d4 + your Intelligence modifier.
